lead_paragraph: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on when a promise to a friend facing death is second to the claims of the living and on whether a scientist should consider weighing in when friends ask about natural and alternative therapies.

headline.print_headline: Can I Tell a Dying Friend’s Secret to His Children?
headline.main: Can I Tell a Dying Friend’s Secret to His Children?

snippet: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on when a promise to a friend facing death is second to the claims of the living and on whether a scientist should consider weighing in when friends ask about natural and alternative therapies....
abstract: Kwame Anthony Appiah The Ethicist column answers questions on whether to tell adult children of dying man that they have secret half-sibling, whether to reveal that friend is dying of cancer and providing medical advice to friends.
